summary.description: This model used to detect FDG-avid lesions in breast from FDG PET/CT scans

inputs.label: Input Image
inputs.description: The CT scan of a patient.

inputs.label: Input Image
inputs.description: The PET scan of a patient.

details.name: AIMI PET CT BREAST
details.type: nnU-Net (U-Net structure, optimized by data-driven heuristics)
details.cite: Murugesan, Gowtham Krishnan, Diana McCrumb, Mariam Aboian, Tej Verma, Rahul Soni, Fatima Memon, and Jeff Van Oss. The AIMI Initiative: AI-Generated Annotations for Imaging Data Commons Collections. arXiv preprint arXiv:2310.14897 (2023).

publications.title: The AIMI Initiative: AI-Generated Annotations in IDC Collections

use.title: Intended Use
use.text: This model is intended to perform segmentations of Breast FDG-avid Tumor region in PET, CT scans. The model has been trained and tested on scans aquired during clinical care of patients, so it might not be suited for a healthy population. The generalization capabilities of the model on a range of ages, genders, and ethnicities are unknown.

analyses.title: Quantitative Analyses
analyses.text: Label-wise metrics (mean (standard deviation)) between AI derived and manual corrected FDG PET/CT lungs and tumor annotations.

references.label: The AIMI Initiative: AI-Generated Annotations for Imaging Data Commons Collections

evaluation.title: Evaluation Data
evaluation.text: 77 validation cases were rated by a radiologist and non-expert

references.label: Image segmentations produced by the AIMI Annotations initiative

training.title: Training Data
training.text: The AutoPET Challenge 2023 dataset is comprised of whole-body FDG-PET/CT data from 900 patients, encompassing 1014 studies with tumor annotations. This dataset was augmented by adding labels for the brain, bladder, kidneys, liver, stomach, spleen, lungs, and heart generated by the TotalSegmentator model. A multi-task AI model was trained using the augmented datasets
